c74object.name: 264.filter~
c74object.digest: Filter audio via a graphical interface.
c74object.description: Apply a lowpass, highpass, bandpass, or bandstop filter in a simple graphical interface.

inlet.description: Signal connected to the first outlet will be filtered according to the module’s settings.

Sets the center or cut-off frequency of the filter. Floats are understood as absolute values in kHz (0.01–22.1). Integers are understood as a MIDI range (0–127) and mapped exponentially to the float range.

Sets the filter’s Q factor (how tight the filter’s response is). Floats are understood as absolute values (0.01–10.). Integers are understood as a MIDI range (0–127) and mapped exponentially to the float range.
Select whether the module is a lowpass, highpass, bandpass, or bandstop filter. 0 = lowpass; 1 = highpass; 2 = bandpass; 3 = bandstop. Floats are truncated rather than rounded up/down, i.e. 1.8 = 1.
Turn the filter bypass on or off. 0 = off; non-zero = on; bang reverses the current state.

outlet.description: Signal that has been filtered according to the module’s settings.

objarg.name: unique id
objarg.description: A unique name allows the module to communicate with the 264 Tools preset mechanisms.

c74object.discussion: Used in a bpatcher, 264.filter~ provides a graphical interface to control an audio filter of various types. Connect to your MIDI controller by clicking on the 264.midi-learn arrows.
